title: Apple App Store : global category revenue share per business model 2014
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of revenue on the Y-axis for 17 different Categorys for 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases that are presented on the X-axis.

For Category Newsstand, Free apps with in-app purchases had the highest Share of revenue 996.0 among the 3 groups and in Newsstand, Paid apps without in-app purchases had the lowest Share of revenue 2.0.
There is a gap of 679.0 between the highest and lowest Share of revenue found for Paid apps without in-app purchases in Category Medical and Newsstand.

On average, the Category Productivity had the highest Share of revenue for all 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases. Whereas Music had the lowest average Share of revenue.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of revenue on the Y-axis for 17 different Categorys for 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases that are presented on the X-axis.

Out of all 3 groups, Free apps with in-app purchases had the highest Share of revenue for Category Newsstand and Paid apps without in-app purchases had the lowest Share of revenue for Category Newsstand.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of revenue on the Y-axis for 17 different Categorys for 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases that are presented on the X-axis.

For Category Newsstand, Free apps with in-app purchases had the highest Share of revenue 996.0 among the 3 groups and in Newsstand, Paid apps without in-app purchases had the lowest Share of revenue 2.0.
There is a gap of 679.0 between the highest and lowest Share of revenue found for Paid apps without in-app purchases in Category Medical and Newsstand.

On average, the Category Productivity had the highest Share of revenue for all 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases. Whereas Music had the lowest average Share of revenue.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 17 different Categorys on X-axis for 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of revenue.

Category Newsstand had the maximum Share of revenue among all 3 groups, and it was for Free apps with in-app purchases. The minimum Share of revenue was observed in Category Newsstand for Paid apps without in-app purchases.
For Category Medical, Paid apps without in-app purchases had the highest Share of revenue among all 17 Categorys and it has the lowest Share of revenue in Category Newsstand.
Category Medical and Newsstand had the biggest gap of 679.0 between the highest and lowest Share of revenue found for Paid apps without in-app purchases.
Among the groups, Free apps with in-app purchases had the biggest difference in Share of revenue. Where the maximum Share of revenue was 47.43 times larger than the minimum Share of revenue.

Free apps with in-app purchases had the maximum Share of revenue out of all 3 groups in Category Newsstand followed by Free apps with in-app purchases in Newsstand, and the minimum Share of revenue is found for Paid apps without in-app purchases in Newsstand.

On average, the Category Productivity had the highest Share of revenue for all 3 groups Free apps with in-app purchases, Paid apps without in-app purchases, and Paid apps with in-app purchases. Whereas Music had the lowest average Share of revenue.
